name: Salisbury Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'ground beef'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'condensed French onion soup'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ketchup'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'mustard powder'}

name: Hamburger Steak with Onions and Gravy
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground beef'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'seasoned salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'onion powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'thinly sliced onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'beef broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'cooking sherry'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'seasoned salt'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Mix ground beef, bread crumbs, egg, Worcestershire sauce, salt, onion powder, garlic powder, and pepper together in a large bowl until combined. Form into 8 balls and flatten into patties.. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add patties and onion; fry until patties are nicely browned, about 4 minutes per side. Transfer beef patties to a plate, and keep warm.. Sprinkle flour over onions and drippings in the skillet. Stir in flour with a fork, scraping bits of beef off of the bottom of the skillet as you stir. Gradually mix in beef broth and sherry. Season with seasoned salt. Simmer and stir over medium-low heat until gravy thickens, about 5 minutes.. Reduce heat to low, return patties to the gravy, cover, and simmer until cooked through, about 15 minutes.. Serve and enjoy!

name: Slow Cooker Salisbury Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'lean ground beef'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Italian seasoned bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1 ounce) envelope', 'name': 'dry onion soup mix'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(10.5 ounce) cans', 'name': 'condensed cream of chicken soup'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1 ounce) packet', 'name': 'dry au jus mix'}
steps: Combine ground beef, bread crumbs, milk, and onion soup mix together in a large bowl until well combined; shape into 8 patties.. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Dredge patties in flour just to coat, and quickly brown on both sides in the hot skillet.. Place browned patties into the slow cooker stacking alternately like a pyramid.. Mix condensed soup, water, and au jus mix together in a medium bowl; pour over the beef patties.. Cook on Low until ground beef is well done, about 4 to 5 hours.

name: Salisbury Steak with Mushrooms
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'lean ground beef'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onions'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'beef broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sliced mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'cornstarch'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'water'}
steps: Combine ground beef, bread crumbs, chopped onion, egg, salt, and black pepper in a large bowl until evenly mixed. Shape beef mixture into 4 patties, about 3/4-inch thick.. Fry patties in a large skillet over medium heat until browned on both sides, about 10 minutes. Add beef broth, onion, and mushrooms; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until patties are no longer pink in the center, about 10 minutes more. Transfer patties to a platter and keep warm.. Bring onion mixture to a boil. Mix cornstarch and water in a small bowl; stir into onion mixture. Cook and stir until onion gravy is thickened, about 1 minute. Pour over patties to serve.

name: Chef John's Salisbury Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': '85% lean ground beef'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ketchup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dry mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'salted butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'salted butter'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'white button mushrooms, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced onion'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'high-quality, low-sodium beef broth'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ketchup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}
steps: Prepare the steaks: Mix ground beef, bread crumbs, egg, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, soy sauce, pepper, and cayenne together in a mixing bowl with a fork or your hands until well combined. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.. When almost ready to cook the steaks, make the gravy: Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Add mushrooms, onion, and salt; sauté until nicely browned, 5 to 8 minutes. Reduce the heat to medium and add flour; cook and stir for 3 minutes.. Stir in broth, ketchup, and Worcestershire sauce. Increase the heat to high and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to medium and cook, stirring occasionally, until gravy thickens slightly and reduces, about 10 minutes. Taste and adjust salt as needed.. Transfer gravy to a liquid measure. Scrape the pan clean with a spatula.. Finish the steaks: Remove meat from the refrigerator and divide into four equal portions. Moisten hands and form each portion into a 1/2-inch-thick oval patty. Lightly season both sides of patties with salt.. Melt butter in the clean skillet over medium-high heat. Add patties and cook until browned, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Pour in gravy and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to medium and continue to cook until gravy is piping hot and steaks are no longer pink in the center, about 5 more minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

name: Midwest Salisbury Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground sirloin'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'panko bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '(1 ounce) package', 'name': 'dry onion soup mix'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh mushrooms, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'sweet onion, sliced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '(1 ounce) package', 'name': 'dry onion soup mix'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'beef stock'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Gather the ingredients.. Make the patties: Mix ground sirloin, panko bread crumbs, egg, milk, 1/2 packet onion soup mix, Worcestershire sauce, and black pepper together in a large bowl; shape into 5 patties.. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Cook patties in the hot skillet until browned, 3 to 5 minutes per side.. Make the gravy: Melt butter in a separate skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté mushrooms and onion in melted butter until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir flour and remaining 1/2 packet onion soup mix into mushroom mixture until combined.. Gradually add beef stock and water, stirring continually, until simmering. Reduce heat to medium; cook, stirring frequently, until gravy has thickened, about 4 to 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.. Place browned patties into gravy; simmer until very tender, about 30 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

name: Hamburger Steaks with Creamy Mushroom Gravy
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'ground beef'}, {'quantity': '25', 'unit': '', 'name': 'saltine crackers, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'black pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'Italian seasoning'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '(10.5 ounce) cans', 'name': 'condensed cream of mushroom soup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'name': 'mushrooms, drained (Optional)'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. Mix ground beef, crackers, milk, pepper, salt, garlic powder, and Italian seasoning together in a large bowl until well combined. Form into eight large patties and place into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Pour condensed soup evenly over patties, then sprinkle canned mushrooms over top. Cover the pan with a lid or aluminum foil.. Bake in the preheated oven until patties are no longer pink in the center, about 45 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

name: Basic Salisbury Steaks
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground beef'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1 ounce) package', 'name': 'dry onion soup mix'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10.75 ounce) can', 'name': 'condensed golden mushroom soup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10.75 ounce) can', 'name': 'water'}
steps: Mix ground beef, bread crumbs, egg, and onion soup mix together in a bowl; shape into 6 oblong patties.. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook patties until browned, about 5 minutes per side.. Stir golden mushroom soup and water together in a bowl; pour over the patties in the skillet. Turn patties to coat in the liquid. Bring liquid to a simmer, reduce heat to medium-low, place a cover on the skillet, and cook until steaks are very firm, hot, and grey in the center, 10 to 15 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

name: Low-Carb Salisbury Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'ground beef'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'dried parsley flakes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'onion powder (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '7', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'sliced button mushrooms, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'beef broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sour cream'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Mix ground beef, onion, eggs, 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, parsley, 2 teaspoons salt, garlic powder, onion powder, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper together in a bowl. Split steak mixture into 6 portions and form into patties.. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook patties, 3 at a time, until slightly browned on one side, about 5 minutes. Flip and cook until other side is browned, about 5 minutes more. Repeat with remaining patties, pouring off any excess liquid. Place Salisbury steaks on a plate and cover with aluminum foil to maintain heat, or keep them warm in the oven.. Melt butter in the same skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Transfer mushrooms to a bowl, reserving butter in the skillet.. Stir flour into the butter until dissolved. Pour in beef broth slowly, stirring until thickened, about 7 minutes. Add 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce; cook, stirring frequently, until gravy starts to thicken slightly, about 5 minutes. Add sour cream and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring until all sour cream is melted and gravy is light brown, about 2 minutes.. Stir mushrooms back into the gravy. Remove from heat and let cool until thickened, about 2 minutes. Ladle gravy and mushrooms over steak patties.

name: Simple and Flavorful Salisbury Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'lean ground beef'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Italian seasoned bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggs, beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1 ounce) package', 'name': 'dry onion soup mix'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10 ounce) can', 'name': 'beef broth, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'cream of mushroom soup'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dry mustard'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. Mix together ground beef, bread crumbs, beaten eggs, onion soup mix, salt, and pepper in a large bowl until well combined. Pour in about 1/2 of the beef broth; continue mixing until mixture is thoroughly moistened. Divide into six equal portions and shape into patties.. Heat a Dutch oven over medium heat. Cook patties in the hot pot until browned, 3 to 5 minutes per side. Discard excess grease, leaving patties in the pot.. Stir together condensed soup, remaining beef broth, and dry mustard in a medium bowl until smooth; pour over browned patties in the pot.. Bake in the preheated oven until patties are no longer pink in the center, about 45 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

name: Family Beef Salisbury Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cooking spray'}, {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'extra-lean ground beef'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped sweet onion'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Italian seasoned bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14 ounce) can', 'name': 'beef broth, divided'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flour, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(10.75 ounce) cans', 'name': 'cream of mushroom soup'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'sweet onion, or to taste, sliced thin'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prepare a large casserole dish with cooking spray.. Lightly mix ground beef, 1/2 cup onion, bread crumbs, 3 tablespoons beef broth, milk, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper together in a bowl; divide into 5 portions and shape into patties.. Season flour with salt and pepper in a wide, shallow dish. Gently lay patties into the flour to lightly coat.. Heat vegetable oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Fry patties in hot oil until browned completely, 3 to 5 minutes per side. Remove patties to a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess grease.. Stir remaining beef broth, cream of mushroom soup, salt, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper together in a bowl until smooth.. Arrange drained patties into the prepared casserole dish. Spread onion slices atop the patties and pour the soup mixture over the patties to cover completely.. Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, 45 minutes to 1 hour. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

name: Instant Pot Salisbury Steak with Onion and Mushroom Gravy
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely diced onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground beef'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'lean ground pork'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'avocado oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'sliced cremini mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry red wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'beef broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'beef broth'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'cornstarch'}
steps: Combine bread crumbs, onion, egg, parsley, Worcestershire sauce, and garlic in a large bowl. Stir well and add beef and pork. Mix gently and form 8 equal portions. Place patties on a plate, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate 1 hour. Remove from the refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking.. Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and select Sauté function. Add oil. Add patties in batches to avoid overcrowding the pot. Sauté 2 minutes per side. Transfer cooked patties to a plate. Add onions to the pot and cook until brown, about 2 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook 2 minutes more.. Pour wine into the pot and stir, scraping up all the brown bits from the bottom. Add broth, tomato paste, salt, and pepper; stir well. Return cooked patties and any accumulated liquid to the pot and turn to coat.. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 15 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid.. Combine 4 tablespoons broth and cornstarch in a bowl and stir until dissolved. Add mixture to the pot slowly, stirring constantly. Select Saute function; cook until thickened, about 5 minutes.

name: Smothered Hamburger Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'beef base'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'black pepper'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'white bread'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'lean ground beef'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10.75 ounce) can', 'name': 'condensed cream of mushroom soup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10.75 ounce) can', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}
steps: Whisk together the eggs, onion, beef base, and pepper in a bowl. Tear the bread into large pieces, and place into the bowl. Let the bread soak for a few seconds and add the ground beef. Mix the meat into the egg-bread mixture, and form into 8 patties.. Heat a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat, and fry the patties until they are browned and the meat is no longer pink in the center, about 8 minutes per side. Set the patties aside.. Remove the excess grease from the skillet, and whisk the mushroom soup, water, and Worcestershire sauce together in the skillet until smooth. Place the patties back into the skillet, spoon sauce over them to cover, and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to a simmer, and cook until the sauce is thickened and the flavors have blended, about 20 minutes.

name: Easy Salisbury Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground beef'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'rolled oats'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ketchup'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'dried minced onion'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'onion, sliced into rings'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10.75 ounce) can', 'name': 'condensed cream of mushroom soup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10.75 ounce) can', 'name': 'milk'}
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. Mix ground beef, oats, egg, Worcestershire sauce, ketchup, water, dried minced onion, salt, and pepper in a bowl until evenly combined; shape into 6 oval-shaped patties.. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Cook patties in hot skillet until browned completely, 2 minutes per side. Transfer browned patties to a baking dish.. Top patties with onion rings. Stir mushroom soup and milk together in a bowl; pour over patties. Cover baking dish with aluminum foil.. Bake in the preheated oven until firm, hot, and grey in the center, about 45 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

name: Scrumptious Salisbury Steak in Mushroom Gravy
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground beef'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'crushed buttery round cracker crumbs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'finely chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'poultry seasoning'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(4 ounce) cans', 'name': 'sliced mushrooms with juice'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cubes', 'name': 'beef bouillon'}
steps: In a medium bowl, mix together the ground beef, egg, cracker crumbs, onion, salt, pepper and poultry seasoning using your hands. Shape into 6 patties about 1 inch thick.. Fry the patties in a large skillet over medium-high heat for 3 to 4 minutes per side, or until browned. Drain off grease, and remove patties to a platter; keep warm.. Melt the butter in the same skillet, and add the mushrooms. Cook and stir for about 2 minutes. Sprinkle the flour over, and mix in until blended. Stir in the milk and beef bouillon. Cook and stir over medium heat until smooth and starting to thicken. Return the patties to the gravy and cook over low heat, uncovered, for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.

name: Hamburgers with Mushroom Gravy
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'ground beef'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'panko bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10.75 ounce) can', 'name': 'condensed cream of mushroom soup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14 ounce) can', 'name': 'beef consomme'}
steps: Combine ground beef, egg, panko bread crumbs, onion, and 1/4 cup cream of mushroom soup in a large bowl. Divide beef mixture evenly into 6 portions; shape each portion into a 1/2-inch-thick patty.. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-heat. Cook the burgers until browned, 3 to 4 minutes on each side.. Whisk together remaining cream of mushroom soup and beef consommé in a bowl until smooth. Pour mixture over patties, then reduce heat to low. Simmer until patties are no longer pink in the center, about 20 minutes.

name: How to Make the Best Homemade Salisbury Steaks
Amish Salisbury Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground beef'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'crushed saltine crackers'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'cream of mushroom soup'}
steps: Mix ground beef, milk, crackers, onion, salt, and black pepper in a bowl. Shape mixture into a narrow loaf and place onto a baking sheet. Cover and refrigerate, 8 hours to overnight.. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cut loaf into 1-inch thick slices and sear in the hot skillet until browned, 2 to 3 minutes per side. The inside will still be pink. Arrange slices in a roasting pan. Spread mushroom soup over steaks.. Bake steaks in the preheated oven until mushroom soup is bubbling and meat is no longer pink inside, about 1 hour. An instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the center of a meat slice should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

name: Sorta Salisbury Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour, divided'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '(4 ounce)', 'name': 'cube steaks (pounded round meat)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'onion, sliced into strips'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'beef stock'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. Heat the oil in a Dutch oven, or deep iron skillet. Dredge steaks in some of the flour, reserving the rest of the flour. Brown steaks in the oil a few at a time, and remove to a plate. When all of the steaks are browned, place a layer of sliced onions into the Dutch oven, and alternate layers of steak and onion. Pour in beef stock and Worcestershire sauce.. Cover, and bake for 2 hours in the preheated oven. Remove steaks and onions from the pan, and whisk in 2 tablespoons of the remaining flour. Bring to a boil over medium heat, and cook, stirring until thickened. Serve steaks and onions with gravy with mashed potatoes or noodles.

name: Broiled Salisbury Steaks
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'extra-lean ground beef'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced green bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'dried thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'all-purpose flour, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'oil, or as needed'}
steps: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.. Mix ground beef, onion, green bell pepper, parsley, salt, paprika, garlic, black pepper, and thyme together in a bowl; divide into 4 portions and shape into patties. Arrange patties on the prepared baking sheet. Dust both sides of patties with flour and brush with oil.. Broil in the preheated oven until steaks are cooked through, 4 to 8 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

name: Baked Salisbury Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'lean ground beef'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'lean ground pork'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato - peeled, seeded and diced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs, lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'black pepper'}
steps: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Lightly grease a large shallow baking dish.. In a large bowl, combine ground beef, ground pork, tomatoes, eggs, onion, garlic, salt and pepper. Mix well. Shape into 12 (4-inch) round patties. Place in baking dish.. Bake in preheated oven for 35 minutes, until evenly brown, and juices run clear. Cook to a minimum of 160 degrees F (73 degrees C).
